description: Known false positives from P21/CORE validation. Matching RuleResults are flagged as known_false_positive=true in report output.

entries.reason: P21 v2405.2 known issue: false positive for numeric LBSTRESC values
P21 v2405.2 known issue: false positive for numeric character results in VS domain (same pattern as LB)
P21 v2405.2 known issue: false positive for numeric character results in EG domain (same pattern as LB)
Variable label mismatch false positive when label differs only by trailing whitespace (P21 formatting sensitivity)
Unexpected variable false positive for SUPPQUAL datasets with study-specific QNAM values (QNAM is extensible by design)
Value not in codelist false positive for valid extensible codelist additions (P21 sometimes flags extensible values as violations)
Missing required value false positive for conditional TS parameters that depend on study design (e.g., PCLAS not required for non-drug studies)
Variable not expected false positive when ARMCD/ARM present for single-arm studies (P21 flags as unexpected but SDTM-IG allows)
DTYPE present without qualifying condition false positive when DTYPE is populated from source data rather than imputation
LBORNRHI/LBORNRLO missing false positive when reference ranges not applicable for qualitative tests (e.g., urinalysis color)
ISO 8601 date format false positive for partial dates with only year (e.g., '2022') which are valid per SDTM-IG partial date rules
